review: I use it daily, mostly for youtube videos but it also works seamlessly with Netflix, Pandora & Hulu. I have used this with a Galaxy S3, Galaxy S4, a dell laptop, Chromebook (Samsung model), a nexus 7 (2013 version) and an iPad. There have been no issues at all with my setup - AT&T; U-Verse internet with an average of 15.5 Mbps downstream. Comparing it to my friend's Apple TV, it definitely is more basic and simple with less features but I believe that makes it even better. He always has a few hiccups in the stream using his apple tv and I've only experienced stalls/interruptions twice.It's not perfect but It's so simple and works great. Definitely worth at at this price. $35 at this time.I have since purchased one for my cousin's tv and she says she uses it daily for streaming netflix cartoons for her kids in the morning.
author: Dan

author: Ali "KSA Future"

review: This product was promptly delivered, nicely packaged and the setup was a whiz. The provision of a power cord to power the adapter is a good idea as many older HDTVs lack a USB port. But this product falls way short of my expectations. For instance this does not allow one to chrome cast any content on your laptop or iphone/ipad, but only those apps that are supported by chromecast or Chrome browser.  For instance I cannot just play any video or image or music file and expect to have the same broadcast to my big screen TV. In short this is not an application that would let you broadcast any local file from your sources (ipad/iphone/desktop/laptop) unless you figure out a way to have the same opened within Google Chrome(need to download Google cast extension) or is one of the 6-8 supported and/or Google-owned apps like YouTube etc.Bottomline: This is a waste of money as I can pretty much access all of the current supported content using either Roku box, or Wii or PS3 consoles or my TV net options(why pay another $35 to get something that only does what you already have...?)Did not do my research enough and made an impulsive buy as the cost is pretty low, but very disappointed with this joke. I was expecting to see an APP that would let me broadcast any file (live or stored from my source systems to the big screen, but we are not there yet..)  Still toying with the idea of going through the hassle of returning the same or writing off this $35 to Google Inc
author: vajra

review: As Netflix users, I think this is a must have product. We were previously watching Netflix through our Blu-Ray player and were often frustrated with it freezing up. With Chromecast we can now cast from our phones or tablets. It is convenient and easy to set up. We also cast you tube videos to our tv and can't wait for Amazon Prime to be added to the list! For the price, you can't go wrong.
